intro: Podandrogyne colombiana, commonly known as the Colombian podandrogyne, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, pentagonal flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a rough, hairy texture. Podandrogyne colombiana is often found in moist, shaded environments within cloud forests.
